body_html:
@wu-hanqing RuntimeError: DataLoader worker (pid 14044) is killed by signal: Aborted. just says that your data loader worker died. It's reporting the same error. The mechanism is there in case your worker is silently killed and prevent the main process from hanging.

I took a second look. It seems that your error is from PIL rather than PyTorch as indicated by

/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x777e5)[0x7f9ba2dd67e5]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x8037a)[0x7f9ba2ddf37a]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(cfree+0x4c)[0x7f9ba2de353c]
/home/whq/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PIL/_imaging.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so(+0x126de)[0x7f9b9b9fa6de]

You could try run with num_workers=0 and see if it works/gives a better trace. But I'll close this for now as the double free is from PIL.

body:
@wu-hanqing `RuntimeError: DataLoader worker (pid 14044) is killed by signal: Aborted.` just says that your data loader worker died. It's reporting the same error. The mechanism is there in case your worker is silently killed and prevent the main process from hanging.

I took a second look. It seems that your error is from PIL rather than PyTorch as indicated by
```
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x777e5)[0x7f9ba2dd67e5]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x8037a)[0x7f9ba2ddf37a]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(cfree+0x4c)[0x7f9ba2de353c]
/home/whq/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/PIL/_imaging.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so(+0x126de)[0x7f9b9b9fa6de]
```

You could try run with `num_workers=0` and see if it works/gives a better trace. But I'll close this for now as the double free is from PIL.
